intro: Hieracium hastatum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium hastatum is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in certain regions.
